explanation:
OS_SocketBindAddress — direct callee of OS_SocketBind; must be inspected for any calls back to OS_SocketBind (direct/indirect).
OS_SocketListen — direct callee of OS_SocketBind; must be inspected for any calls back to OS_SocketBind (direct/indirect).
OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl — implementation-level callee of OS_SocketBindAddress; could contain a call path back to OS_SocketBind.
OS_SocketListen_Impl — implementation-level callee of OS_SocketListen; could contain a call path back to OS_SocketBind.
OS_ObjectIdGetById — helper called by the above callees; included because it could (in theory) call higher-level APIs that lead back to OS_SocketBind.
OS_ObjectIndexFromToken — helper called by the above callees; include to check for indirect recursion paths.
OS_ObjectIdRelease — helper called by the above callees; include to check for indirect recursion paths.
OS_CreateSocketName — helper called by OS_SocketBindAddress; include to ensure it does not call back into socket APIs that could reach OS_SocketBind.
OS_printf — utility called by OS_SocketBindAddress; include to rule out unexpected call-back paths (conservative).
UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType — unit-test/stub helper called by callees; stubs can wrap/redirect calls, so include to ensure no stubbed path calls OS_SocketBind.
UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData — unit-test/stub helper called by callees; include for the same reason as other UT_* stubs.
UT_ExecuteBasicHandler — unit-test/stub executor called by callees; include because handler functions could invoke application APIs including OS_SocketBind.
UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr — unit-test/stub helper called by callees; include to check for indirect stub-induced recursion.
UT_GetStubEntry — underlying UT helper called by several UT_* functions; include to trace any stub handler that might call back.
UT_ClearStubEntry — UT helper; include for completeness of the UT call chain.
UT_SetHandlerFunction — UT helper that can install handlers invoked by UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; include because installed handlers could call OS_SocketBind.
UT_DefaultStubImpl — default stub implementation called by UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; include to ensure it doesn't call OS_SocketBind.
UtAssert_Abort — UT assertion helper called by UT_*; include to ensure no unusual control-flow back to OS_SocketBind.
UtAssert_GetContext — UT helper called by UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr; include for completeness of the UT call chain.

Rationale: To prove absence (or presence) of direct or indirect recursion from OS_SocketBind, the analysis must inspect all functions it directly calls and their transitive callees that could possibly call back to OS_SocketBind. The listed symbols are the direct callees and the transitive helper/UT functions reachable from them (per the provided static call graph) and therefore are required to establish whether any call path returns to OS_SocketBind.
